bill_title: to permit all but one petitioner to waive personal appearance at a hearing for termination of parental rights.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to permit all but one petitioner to waive personal appearance at a hearing for termination of parental rights. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 25-5A-14 be amended to read as follows: 25-5A-14. The personal presence of the petitioner or petitioners at the hearing shall be is jurisdictional ; provided however, that all persons . However, any person whose consent is necessary, except the mother one petitioner , may appear by a person filing with the court a power of attorney. In the event that If the Department of Social Services or a licensed child placement agency has custody of a child by written agreement of a parent or parents with power of attorney to consent, its the secretary or his an authorized agent may appear and consent. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to permit all but one petitioner to waive personal appearance at a hearing for termination of parental rights. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 25-5A-14 be amended to read as follows: 25-5A-14. The personal presence of the petitioner or petitioners at the hearing shall be is jurisdictional ; provided however, that all persons . However, any person whose consent is necessary, except the mother, may appear by a person filing with the court a power of attorney. In the event that If the mother has abandoned the child for six months, the presence of the mother is not required, and consent may be filed with the court through a power of attorney. If the Department of Social Services or a licensed child placement agency has custody of a child by written agreement of a parent or parents with power of attorney to consent, its the secretary or his an authorized agent may appear and consent. BILL HISTORY January 17 - First read in Senate and referred to Judiciary. S.J. 60 January 22 - Scheduled for hearing. January 22 - Passed as amended, PASSED, AYES 7, NAYS 0. S.J. 88

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to permit all but one petitioner to waive personal appearance at a hearing for termination of parental rights. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 25-5A-14 be amended to read as follows: 25-5A-14. The personal presence of the petitioner or petitioners at the hearing shall be jurisdictional; provided however, that all persons whose consent is necessary, except the mother, may appear by a person one parent at the hearing is required for jurisdictional purposes. However, any other person whose consent is necessary, may appear by filing with the court a power of attorney. In the event that If the Department of Social Services or a licensed child placement agency has custody of a child by written agreement of a parent or parents with power of attorney to consent, its the secretary or his an authorized agent may appear and consent. BILL HISTORY 1/17/97 First read in Senate and referred to Judiciary. S.J. 60 1/22/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/22/97 Judiciary Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 0. 1/24/97 Senate Deferred to another day. S.J. 164 1/27/97 Senate Deferred to another day. S.J. 179 1/28/97 Senate Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 34, NAYS 0. S.J. 197 1/29/97 First read in House and referred to Judiciary. H.J. 208 2/15/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/15/97 Judiciary Deferred to another day. H.J. 510 2/19/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/21/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/26/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 3/3/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 3/3/97 Judiciary Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 12, NAYS 0.
